questions.text: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.

questions.text: Which is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River in Africa is approximately 6,650 km long, making it the longest river in the world.

questions.text: Which continent is the largest by land area?
questions.explanation: Asia is the largest continent, covering about 44.58 million square kilometers.

questions.text: What is the smallest country in the world by area?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world at approximately 0.44 square kilometers.

questions.text: Which ocean is the largest?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean, covering more than 165 million square kilometers.

questions.text: What is the capital of Japan?
questions.explanation: Tokyo is the capital of Japan and one of the most populous metropolitan areas in the world.

questions.text: Mount Everest is located on the border of which two countries?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest sits on the border between Nepal and China (Tibet Autonomous Region).

questions.text: Which country has the most natural lakes?
questions.explanation: Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined, with an estimated 2 million lakes.

questions.text: What is the driest continent on Earth?
questions.explanation: Antarctica is the driest continent, receiving very little precipitation, mostly as snow.

questions.text: The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of which country?
questions.explanation: The Great Barrier Reef is off the northeast coast of Australia in the Coral Sea.

questions.text: What is the capital of Brazil?
questions.explanation: Brasilia has been the capital of Brazil since 1960, replacing Rio de Janeiro.

questions.text: Which African country was formerly known as Abyssinia?
questions.explanation: Ethiopia was historically known as Abyssinia, one of the oldest nations in Africa.

questions.text: Which strait separates Europe from Africa?
questions.explanation: The Strait of Gibraltar separates Spain (Europe) from Morocco (Africa) at only 14 km wide.

questions.text: What is the largest desert in the world?
questions.explanation: The Antarctic Desert is the largest desert at about 14 million sq km. The Sahara is the largest hot desert.

questions.text: Which country is known as the Land of the Rising Sun?
questions.explanation: Japan is known as the Land of the Rising Sun. The name Japan (Nihon) literally means 'origin of the sun.'

questions.text: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital of Australia, chosen as a compromise between rivals Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.text: Which river flows through the Grand Canyon?
questions.explanation: The Colorado River carved the Grand Canyon over millions of years.

questions.text: In which country would you find Machu Picchu?
questions.explanation: Machu Picchu is a 15th-century Inca citadel located in the Andes Mountains of Peru.

questions.text: What is the largest island in the world?
questions.explanation: Greenland is the world's largest island at about 2.166 million square kilometers.

questions.text: Which sea is the lowest point on Earth's surface?
questions.explanation: The Dead Sea shore is about 430 meters below sea level, the lowest land elevation on Earth.

questions.text: What is the capital of Canada?
questions.explanation: Ottawa, located in Ontario, has been the capital of Canada since 1857.

questions.text: Which mountain range separates Europe from Asia?
questions.explanation: The Ural Mountains form the traditional boundary between Europe and Asia, running through Russia.

questions.text: What is the most populous country in Africa?
questions.explanation: Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa with over 220 million people.

questions.text: Which country contains the most time zones?
questions.explanation: France has 12 time zones due to its overseas territories, more than any other country.

questions.text: What is the deepest point in the ocean?
questions.explanation: The Challenger Deep in the Mariana Trench is about 10,935 meters deep, the deepest known point.

questions.text: Which European country is shaped like a boot?
questions.explanation: Italy's distinctive boot shape is one of the most recognizable country outlines in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Egypt?
questions.explanation: Cairo is the capital of Egypt and the largest city in the Arab world.

questions.text: The Amazon Rainforest is primarily located in which country?
questions.explanation: About 60% of the Amazon Rainforest is within Brazil's borders.

questions.text: Which landlocked country is the largest in the world?
questions.explanation: Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country at about 2.725 million square kilometers.

questions.text: What is the tallest mountain in Africa?
questions.explanation: Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania stands at 5,895 meters, the highest peak in Africa.

questions.text: Which country is both in Europe and Asia?
questions.explanation: Turkey spans both continents, with a small portion in southeastern Europe (Thrace) and the rest in Asia (Anatolia).

questions.text: What is the capital of South Korea?
questions.explanation: Seoul is the capital and largest city of South Korea.

questions.text: Which lake is the largest freshwater lake by surface area?
questions.explanation: Lake Superior has the largest surface area of any freshwater lake at about 82,100 square kilometers.

questions.text: In which country is the Serengeti National Park?
questions.explanation: The Serengeti National Park is in northern Tanzania, famous for the annual wildebeest migration.

questions.text: What is the capital of New Zealand?
questions.explanation: Wellington is the capital of New Zealand, located at the southern tip of the North Island.

questions.text: Which river is the longest in Europe?
questions.explanation: The Volga River in Russia is the longest river in Europe at about 3,530 kilometers.

questions.text: What is the only continent with no active volcanoes?
questions.explanation: The Australian mainland has no active volcanoes, making it the only continent without them.

questions.text: Which country has the longest coastline in the world?
questions.explanation: Canada has the longest coastline in the world at approximately 243,042 kilometers.

questions.text: The Taj Mahal is located in which Indian city?
questions.explanation: The Taj Mahal is in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan.

questions.text: What is the capital of Turkey?
questions.explanation: Ankara is the capital of Turkey. Istanbul is the largest city but not the capital.

questions.text: Which is the smallest ocean?
questions.explanation: The Arctic Ocean is the smallest and shallowest of the five major oceans.

questions.text: In which country is the ancient city of Petra?
questions.explanation: Petra is a famous archaeological site in southern Jordan, carved into rose-red cliffs.

questions.text: What is the largest country in South America by area?
questions.explanation: Brazil is the largest country in South America and the fifth largest in the world.

questions.text: Which waterfall is the tallest in the world?
questions.explanation: Angel Falls in Venezuela is the tallest uninterrupted waterfall at 979 meters.

questions.text: What is the capital of Thailand?
questions.explanation: Bangkok is the capital and most populous city of Thailand.

questions.text: Which African country has the pyramids of Giza?
questions.explanation: The Great Pyramids of Giza are located on the outskirts of Cairo, Egypt.

questions.text: What is the longest mountain range in the world?
questions.explanation: The Andes in South America stretch about 7,000 km, making them the longest continental mountain range.

questions.text: Which country is home to the Great Wall?
questions.explanation: The Great Wall of China stretches over 21,000 km across northern China.

questions.text: What is the capital of Argentina?
questions.explanation: Buenos Aires is the capital and largest city of Argentina.

questions.text: Which island nation is located in the Indian Ocean east of Africa?
questions.explanation: Madagascar is the fourth-largest island in the world, located off the southeast coast of Africa.

questions.text: What is the deepest lake in the world?
questions.explanation: Lake Baikal in Siberia, Russia is the deepest lake at about 1,642 meters deep.

questions.text: Which country is the Sahara Desert primarily located in?
questions.explanation: The Sahara spans 11 countries including Algeria, Libya, Egypt, Morocco, and others. Algeria has the largest portion.

questions.text: What is the capital of Germany?
questions.explanation: Berlin is the capital and largest city of Germany.

questions.text: Which country has the most islands in the world?
questions.explanation: Sweden has approximately 267,570 islands, the most of any country in the world.

questions.text: On which continent is the Atacama Desert?
questions.explanation: The Atacama Desert is in northern Chile, South America, and is one of the driest places on Earth.

questions.text: What is the capital of India?
questions.explanation: New Delhi is the capital of India, part of the larger Delhi metropolitan area.

questions.text: Which river runs through London?
questions.explanation: The River Thames flows through London and is the longest river entirely in England.

questions.text: Which country is the Colosseum located in?
questions.explanation: The Colosseum is in Rome, Italy, built in 70-80 AD as an amphitheatre.

questions.text: What is the largest country in the world by area?
questions.explanation: Russia is the largest country at about 17.1 million square kilometers.

questions.text: Which canal connects the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans?
questions.explanation: The Panama Canal connects the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans through Central America.

questions.text: What is the capital of Nigeria?
questions.explanation: Abuja has been the capital of Nigeria since 1991, replacing Lagos.

questions.text: Which mountain is the tallest in North America?
questions.explanation: Denali (formerly Mount McKinley) in Alaska stands at 6,190 meters, the highest peak in North America.

questions.text: Which city is located on two continents?
questions.explanation: Istanbul straddles Europe and Asia, divided by the Bosporus Strait.

questions.text: What is the capital of Kenya?
questions.explanation: Nairobi is the capital and largest city of Kenya.

questions.text: Which river flows through Paris?
questions.explanation: The Seine River flows through the center of Paris.

questions.text: In which country is Mount Fuji?
questions.explanation: Mount Fuji is the tallest mountain in Japan at 3,776 meters, located on Honshu island.

questions.text: What is the capital of Morocco?
questions.explanation: Rabat is the capital of Morocco. Casablanca is the largest city.

questions.text: Which is the largest lake in Africa?
questions.explanation: Lake Victoria is the largest lake in Africa and the second-largest freshwater lake by surface area globally.

questions.text: In which South American country would you find the Galapagos Islands?
questions.explanation: The Galapagos Islands are a province of Ecuador, located about 1,000 km off its coast.

questions.text: What is the capital of Vietnam?
questions.explanation: Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam. Ho Chi Minh City (formerly Saigon) is the largest city.

questions.text: The Danube River flows into which body of water?
questions.explanation: The Danube River empties into the Black Sea through the Danube Delta in Romania and Ukraine.

questions.text: Which country is home to Angkor Wat?
questions.explanation: Angkor Wat is a massive temple complex in Siem Reap, Cambodia, built in the 12th century.

questions.text: What is the capital of Poland?
questions.explanation: Warsaw is the capital and largest city of Poland.

questions.text: Which peninsula contains Spain and Portugal?
questions.explanation: The Iberian Peninsula in southwestern Europe contains Spain, Portugal, Andorra, and Gibraltar.

questions.text: What is the highest waterfall in Africa?
questions.explanation: Tugela Falls in South Africa is the tallest waterfall in Africa at 948 meters.

questions.text: Which country has the most volcanoes?
questions.explanation: Indonesia has about 130 active volcanoes, the most of any country, due to its position on the Ring of Fire.

questions.text: What is the capital of Peru?
questions.explanation: Lima is the capital and largest city of Peru, located on the Pacific coast.

questions.text: Which body of water is the saltiest in the world?
questions.explanation: Don Juan Pond in Antarctica has a salinity of over 40%, making it the saltiest body of water on Earth.

questions.text: Which African country is entirely surrounded by South Africa?
questions.explanation: Lesotho is an enclave entirely surrounded by South Africa. Eswatini (Swaziland) also borders Mozambique.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: Manila is the capital of the Philippines. Quezon City is the most populous city in Metro Manila.
